"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[{"name":"_connectorToken","type":"address"}],"name":"getConnectorBalance","outputs":[{"name":"","type":"uint256"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":false,"inputs":[{"name":"_bancorX","type":"address"}],"name":"setBancorX","outputs":[],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"constant":false,"inputs":[{"name":"_path","type":"address[]"},{"name":"_amount","type":"uint256"},{"name":"_minReturn","type":"uint256"},{"name":"_affiliateAccount","type":"address"},{"name":"_affiliateFee","type":"uint256"}],"name":"quickConvert2","outputs":[{"name":"","type":"uint256"}],"payable":true,"stateMutability":"payable","type":"function"},{"constant":false,"inputs":[{"name":"_newManager","type":"address"}],"name":"transferManagement","outputs":[],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"constant":false,"inputs":[{"name":"_conversionFee","type":"uint32"}],"name":"setConversionFee","outputs":[],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"constant":false,"inputs":[{"name":"_path","type":"address[]"},{"name":"_amount","type":"uint256"},{"name":"_minReturn","type":"uint256"}],"name":"quickConvert","outputs":[{"name":"","type":"uint256"}],"payable":true,"stateMutability":"payable","type":"function"},{"constant":false,"inputs":[{"name":"_newOwner","type":"address"}],"name":"transferOwnership","outputs":[],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[],"name":"NON_STANDARD_TOKEN_REGISTRY","outputs":[{"name":"","type":"bytes32"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":false,"inputs":[{"name":"_disable","type":"bool"}],"name":"disableRegistryUpdate","outputs":[],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[],"name":"token","outputs":[{"name":"","type":"address"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":false,"inputs":[{"name":"_from","type":"address"},{"name":"_amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"claimTokens","outputs":[],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"name":"_token","type":"address"},{"name":"_registry","type":"address"},{"name":"_maxConversionFee","type":"uint32"},{"name":"_connectorToken","type":"address"},{"name":"_connectorWeight","type":"uint32"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"constructor"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":true,"name":"_fromToken","type":"address"},{"indexed":true,"name":"_toToken","type":"address"},{"indexed":true,"name":"_trader","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_amount","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_return","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_conversionFee","type":"int256"}],"name":"Conversion","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":true,"name":"_connectorToken","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_tokenSupply","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_connectorBalance","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_connectorWeight","type":"uint32"}],"name":"PriceDataUpdate","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":false,"name":"_prevFee","type":"uint32"},{"indexed":false,"name":"_newFee","type":"uint32"}],"name":"ConversionFeeUpdate","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":false,"name":"_conversionsEnabled","type":"bool"}],"name":"ConversionsEnable","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":true,"name":"_prevManager","type":"address"},{"indexed":true,"name":"_newManager","type":"address"}],"name":"ManagerUpdate","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":true,"name":"_prevOwner","type":"address"},{"indexed":true,"name":"_newOwner","type":"address"}],"name":"OwnerUpdate","type":"event"}],"devdoc":{"methods":{"acceptManagement()":{"details":"used by a new manager to accept a management transfer\r"},"acceptOwnership()":{"details":"used by a new owner to accept an ownership transfer\r"},"acceptTokenOwnership()":{"details":"used by a new owner to accept a token ownership transfer\r can only be called by the contract owner\r"},"addConnector(address,uint32,bool)":{"details":"defines a new connector for the token\r can only be called by the owner while the converter is inactive\r \r","params":{"_enableVirtualBalance":"true to enable virtual balance for the connector, false to disable it\r","_token":"address of the connector token\r","_weight":"constant connector weight, represented in ppm, 1-1000000\r"}},"change(address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility\r"},"claimTokens(address,uint256)":{"details":"allows the associated BancorX contract to claim tokens from any address (so that users\r dont have to first give allowance when calling BancorX)\r \r","params":{"_amount":"the amount of tokens to claim\r","_from":"address to claim the tokens from\r"}},"completeXConversion(address[],uint256,uint256,uint256,uint8,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility\r"},"completeXConversion2(address[],uint256,uint256,uint256[])":{"details":"allows a user to convert BNT that was sent from another blockchain into any other\r token on the BancorNetwork without specifying the amount of BNT to be converted, but\r rather by providing the xTransferId which allows us to get the amount from BancorX.\r \r","params":{"_conversionId":"pre-determined unique (if non zero) id which refers to this transaction \r","_minReturn":"if the conversion results in an amount smaller than the minimum return - it is cancelled, must be nonzero\r","_path":"conversion path, see conversion path format in the BancorNetwork contract\r","_signature":"an array of the following elements:\r                        [0] uint256     custom value that was signed for prioritized conversion; must be equal to _conversionId\r                        [1] uint256     if the current block exceeded the given parameter - it is cancelled\r                        [2] uint8       (signature[128:130]) associated with the signer address and helps to validate if the signature is legit\r                        [3] bytes32     (signature[0:64]) associated with the signer address and helps to validate if the signature is legit\r                        [4] bytes32     (signature[64:128]) associated with the signer address and helps to validate if the signature is legit\r                        if the array is empty (length == 0), then the gas-price limit is verified instead of the signature\r \r"},"return":"tokens issued in return\r"},"connectorTokenCount()":{"details":"returns the number of connector tokens defined\r \r","return":"number of connector tokens\r"},"convert(address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility\r"},"convert2(address,address,uint256,uint256,address,uint256)":{"details":"converts a specific amount of _fromToken to _toToken\r \r","params":{"_affiliateAccount":"affiliate account\r","_affiliateFee":"affiliate fee in PPM\r \r","_amount":"amount to convert, in fromToken\r","_fromToken":"ERC20 token to convert from\r","_minReturn":"if the conversion results in an amount smaller than the minimum return - it is cancelled, must be nonzero\r","_toToken":"ERC20 token to convert to\r"},"return":"conversion return amount\r"},"convertInternal(address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"converts a specific amount of _fromToken to _toToken\r can only be called by the bancor network contract\r \r","params":{"_amount":"amount to convert, in fromToken\r","_fromToken":"ERC20 token to convert from\r","_minReturn":"if the conversion results in an amount smaller than the minimum return - it is cancelled, must be nonzero\r \r","_toToken":"ERC20 token to convert to\r"},"return":"conversion return amount\r"},"disableConnectorSale(address,bool)":{"details":"disables converting from the given connector token in case the connector token got compromised\r can only be called by the owner\r note that converting to the token is still enabled regardless of this flag and it cannot be disabled by the owner\r \r","params":{"_connectorToken":"connector token contract address\r","_disable":"true to disable the token, false to re-enable it\r"}},"disableConversions(bool)":{"details":"disables the entire conversion functionality\r this is a safety mechanism in case of a emergency\r can only be called by the manager\r \r","params":{"_disable":"true to disable conversions, false to re-enable them\r"}},"disableRegistryUpdate(bool)":{"details":"disables the registry update functionality\r this is a safety mechanism in case of a emergency\r can only be called by the manager or owner\r \r","params":{"_disable":"true to disable registry updates, false to re-enable them\r"}},"disableTokenTransfers(bool)":{"details":"disables/enables token transfers\r can only be called by the contract owner\r \r","params":{"_disable":"true to disable transfers, false to enable them\r"}},"fund(uint256)":{"details":"buys the token with all connector tokens using the same percentage\r i.e. if the caller increases the supply by 10%, it will cost an amount equal to\r 10% of each connector token balance\r can only be called if the max total weight is exactly 100% and while conversions are enabled\r \r","params":{"_amount":"amount to increase the supply by (in the smart token)\r"}},"getConnectorBalance(address)":{"details":"returns the connector's virtual balance if one is defined, otherwise returns the actual balance\r \r","params":{"_connectorToken":"connector token contract address\r \r"},"return":"connector balance\r"},"getCrossConnectorReturn(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"returns the expected return for selling one of the connector tokens for another connector token\r \r","params":{"_fromConnectorToken":"contract address of the connector token to convert from\r","_sellAmount":"amount to sell (in the from connector token)\r \r","_toConnectorToken":"contract address of the connector token to convert to\r"},"return":"expected sale return amount and conversion fee (in the to connector token)\r"},"getFinalAmount(uint256,uint8)":{"details":"given a return amount, returns the amount minus the conversion fee\r \r","params":{"_amount":"return amount\r","_magnitude":"1 for standard conversion, 2 for cross connector conversion\r \r"},"return":"return amount minus conversion fee\r"},"getPurchaseReturn(address,uint256)":{"details":"returns the expected return for buying the token for a connector token\r \r","params":{"_connectorToken":"connector token contract address\r","_depositAmount":"amount to deposit (in the connector token)\r \r"},"return":"expected purchase return amount and conversion fee\r"},"getReturn(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"returns the expected return for converting a specific amount of _fromToken to _toToken\r \r","params":{"_amount":"amount to convert, in fromToken\r \r","_fromToken":"ERC20 token to convert from\r","_toToken":"ERC20 token to convert to\r"},"return":"expected conversion return amount and conversion fee\r"},"getSaleReturn(address,uint256)":{"details":"returns the expected return for selling the token for one of its connector tokens\r \r","params":{"_connectorToken":"connector token contract address\r","_sellAmount":"amount to sell (in the smart token)\r \r"},"return":"expected sale return amount and conversion fee\r"},"liquidate(uint256)":{"details":"sells the token for all connector tokens using the same percentage\r i.e. if the holder sells 10% of the supply, they will receive 10% of each\r connector token balance in return\r can only be called if the max total weight is exactly 100%\r note that the function can also be called if conversions are disabled\r \r","params":{"_amount":"amount to liquidate (in the smart token)\r"}},"quickConvert(address[],uint256,uint256)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility\r"},"quickConvert2(address[],uint256,uint256,address,uint256)":{"details":"converts the token to any other token in the bancor network by following a predefined conversion path\r note that when converting from an ERC20 token (as opposed to a smart token), allowance must be set beforehand\r \r","params":{"_affiliateAccount":"affiliate account\r","_affiliateFee":"affiliate fee in PPM\r \r","_amount":"amount to convert from (in the initial source token)\r","_minReturn":"if the conversion results in an amount smaller than the minimum return - it is cancelled, must be nonzero\r","_path":"conversion path, see conversion path format in the BancorNetwork contract\r"},"return":"tokens issued in return\r"},"quickConvertPrioritized(address[],uint256,uint256,uint256,uint8,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility\r"},"quickConvertPrioritized2(address[],uint256,uint256,uint256[],address,uint256)":{"details":"converts the token to any other token in the bancor network by following a predefined conversion path\r note that when converting from an ERC20 token (as opposed to a smart token), allowance must be set beforehand\r \r","params":{"_affiliateAccount":"affiliate account\r","_affiliateFee":"affiliate fee in PPM\r \r","_amount":"amount to convert from (in the initial source token)\r","_minReturn":"if the conversion results in an amount smaller than the minimum return - it is cancelled, must be nonzero\r","_path":"conversion path, see conversion path format in the BancorNetwork contract\r","_signature":"an array of the following elements:\r                            [0] uint256     custom value that was signed for prioritized conversion; must be equal to _amount\r                            [1] uint256     if the current block exceeded the given parameter - it is cancelled\r                            [2] uint8       (signature[128:130]) associated with the signer address and helps to validate if the signature is legit\r                            [3] bytes32     (signature[0:64]) associated with the signer address and helps to validate if the signature is legit\r                            [4] bytes32     (signature[64:128]) associated with the signer address and helps to validate if the signature is legit\r                            if the array is empty (length == 0), then the gas-price limit is verified instead of the signature\r"},"return":"tokens issued in return\r"},"restoreRegistry()":{"details":"security mechanism allowing the converter owner to revert to the previous registry,\r to be used in emergency scenario\r"},"setBancorX(address)":{"details":"allows the owner to set the associated BancorX contract\r","params":{"_bancorX":"BancorX contract\r"}},"setConversionFee(uint32)":{"details":"updates the current conversion fee\r can only be called by the manager\r \r","params":{"_conversionFee":"new conversion fee, represented in ppm\r"}},"setConversionWhitelist(address)":{"details":"allows the owner to update & enable the conversion whitelist contract address\r when set, only addresses that are whitelisted are actually allowed to use the converter\r note that the whitelist check is actually done by the BancorNetwork contract\r \r","params":{"_whitelist":"address of a whitelist contract\r"}},"transferManagement(address)":{"details":"allows transferring the contract management\r the new manager still needs to accept the transfer\r can only be called by the contract manager\r \r","params":{"_newManager":"new contract manager\r"}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"allows transferring the contract ownership\r the new owner still needs to accept the transfer\r can only be called by the contract owner\r \r","params":{"_newOwner":"new contract owner\r"}},"transferTokenOwnership(address)":{"details":"allows transferring the token ownership\r the new owner needs to accept the transfer\r can only be called by the contract owner\r note that token ownership can only be transferred while the owner is the converter upgrader contract\r \r","params":{"_newOwner":"new token owner\r"}},"updateConnector(address,uint32,bool,uint256)":{"details":"updates one of the token connectors\r can only be called by the owner\r \r","params":{"_connectorToken":"address of the connector token\r","_enableVirtualBalance":"true to enable virtual balance for the connector, false to disable it\r","_virtualBalance":"new connector's virtual balance\r","_weight":"constant connector weight, represented in ppm, 1-1000000\r"}},"updateRegistry()":{"details":"sets the contract registry to whichever address the current registry is pointing to\r"},"upgrade()":{"details":"upgrades the converter to the latest version\r can only be called by the owner\r note that the owner needs to call acceptOwnership/acceptManagement on the new converter after the upgrade\r"},"withdrawFromToken(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"withdraws tokens held by the controller and sends them to an account\r can only be called by the owner\r \r","params":{"_amount":"amount to withdraw\r","_to":"account to receive the new amount\r","_token":"ERC20 token contract address\r"}},"withdrawTokens(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"withdraws tokens held by the converter and sends them to an account\r can only be called by the owner\r note that connector tokens can only be withdrawn by the owner while the converter is inactive\r unless the owner is the converter upgrader contract\r \r","params":{"_amount":"amount to withdraw\r","_to":"account to receive the new amount\r","_token":"ERC20 token contract address\r"}}}},"userdoc":{"methods":{}}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"/Users/cryptotom/code/gitcoin/communiteths/contracts/bancor/converter/BancorConverter.sol":"BancorConverter"},"evmVersion":"byzantium","libraries":{},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"/Users/cryptotom/code/gitcoin/communiteths/contracts/bancor/ContractIds.sol":{"keccak256":"0xecc7d51589586df08d50ab31c581fb85d05b27a47e0d6907b51ca10f0cebcbd9","urls":["bzzr://1e6f48ff88a6925b1b8f86e577cd1354d2f4bcb1c7a371fc83d7829b2b2bc437"]},"/Users/cryptotom/code/gitcoin/communiteths/contracts/bancor/FeatureIds.sol":{"keccak256":"0xf45743ec73f6982aff22302af4a7bcce244bef0a3eb0aeacd8b32dad625bb454","urls":["bzzr://62d7b08633c4ca50e9cbfe0eafd6623cb6fc170278537f5c234069c0f9afa169"]},"/Users/cryptotom/code/gitcoin/communiteths/contracts/bancor/IBancorNetwork.sol":{"keccak256":"0xbea075ac6211af9d044f58068aac7ba337ab6c4c74238a39fb295e016f156578","urls":["bzzr://a512ad1920373e55297a38a08e8e3f36dd4a7d6f3d28f518b0af81ff6061d974"]},"/Users/cryptotom/code/gitcoin/communiteths/contracts/bancor/bancorx/interfaces/IBancorX.sol":{"keccak256":"0x23d2f7e6d9f9028d547860714cf0494ee508ba525f1d50ecdb05665a04908cea","urls":["bzzr://4062f3a5102874394adffa0b616e2f9bf7faa0dc37cc9611505e2943e451cc0a"]},"/Users/cryptotom/code/gitcoin/communiteths/contracts/bancor/converter/BancorConverter.sol":{"keccak256":"0xa6cf2432781a4de92e554831ce74564afa6cc4d865f5a6878511b5dfcbef566e","urls":["bzzr://6e9b1f579e07b6756f25084aa68b4d80a3c76994cafc163f2ca171ae1cf7ac78"]},"/Users/cryptotom/code/gitcoin/communiteths/contracts/bancor/converter/interfaces/IBancorConverter.sol":{"keccak256":"0x12fbc554708bc8025208e70b6fb45defc13dde848fb255c1b7f081e874a6e870","urls":["bzzr://6ff0ca8278f418fe34f58facaf6e3ee6643bc2b164ee4439d29f84c95728b072"]},"/Users/cryptotom/code/gitcoin/communiteths/contracts/bancor/converter/interfaces/IBancorConverterUpgrader.sol":{"keccak256":"0x295d67fd062b39eeb1bcaf7253917978b058147f6cd6f7fa541b51301 r/utility/Managed.sol":{"keccak256":"0x4d5be46cdbf82633a0f41ba288464db9dcac50057ffe250e19fa3399cb7134ec","urls":["bzzr://049550dfdb38027fb16041a070b55fb5cddf1df46b0824bd5844389056885d90"]},"/Users/cryptotom/code/gitcoin/communiteths/contracts/bancor/utility/Owned.sol":{"keccak256":"0x599f08617f7ec2d1e250ec6f90852319cb94944d82026c459bb66a39c93138bf","urls":["bzzr://0e04734a4b9a2343cea3476f13d616b0fcf174e76bd0fc5478335786e0336bef"]},"/Users/cryptotom/code/gitcoin/communiteths/contracts/bancor/utility/SafeMath.sol":{"keccak256":"0x1da299da4f5b50ea11c19a98ff519e8a7c2626222105cbfa0b3c6bbbd726ab7d","urls":["bzzr://e49efd2cc2a188b1fc641ebcdaf1bb262904e45060deb343c4d59ca4dac63034"]},"/Users/cryptotom/code/gitcoin/communiteths/contracts/bancor/utility/TokenHolder.sol":{"keccak256":"0x0270b93239724e365013de7692a4489083c747352cd3564c6492ae61ae704559","urls":["bzzr://c41fcc0b55fea724c76fac1d946844c2f7e1086999016e89e95d4d2175dac11d"]},"/Users/cryptotom/code/gitcoin/communiteths/contracts/bancor/utility/Utils.sol":{"keccak256":"0xc6c712f4e559fe6c03d9f84aebc93869bf48ec740355bc4add307e0bbbc41edc","urls":["bzzr://d61b1565f341056ca6a4dd33640327bb55e698c2785c4606972da2acccf439f0"]},"/Users/cryptotom/code/gitcoin/communiteths/contracts/bancor/utility/interfaces/IAddressList.sol":{"keccak256":"0x3de4d53e90ce340cf45e9fde143fa6956ff0ab2c40a8ac7f155995ab09736390","urls":["bzzr://cc8bbe33aa156cd273b4f60ef678bd489c9a052962323c48ae571625ec5f686a"]},"/Users/cryptotom/code/gitcoin/communiteths/contracts/bancor/utility/interfaces/IContractFeatures.sol":{"keccak256":"0x021e780f03961a8498409da5e57e36844bb6d06e6c6acf8a895f23c4c260b33e","urls":["bzzr://825b4d839d0bca34665f11c61b52de5887cb068302a4cbd262c5bf994b16940d"]},"/Users/cryptotom/code/gitcoin/communiteths/contracts/bancor/utility/interfaces/IContractRegistry.sol":{"keccak256":"0x4fc9f35a48ef73f00d5ea0a6fb2018eb5801f1c5b828935a34cfebf479084c86","urls":["bzzr://3f880643a62ae35a2592ea2f079452a9276dc1d54d5d1c33462738109c787db5"]},"/Users/cryptotom/code/gitcoin/communiteths/contracts/bancor/utility/interfaces/IOwned.sol":{"keccak256":"0x3bfadfd06a9f37a8687474694252513f00d84ff9074c9d3c69c311d62686e588","urls":["bzzr://b168ba3d91c3119b53b54679bec05592fe124e42f2345e785a4fd08c8225b39e"]},"/Users/cryptotom/code/gitcoin/communiteths/contracts/bancor/utility/interfaces/ITokenHolder.sol":{"keccak256":"0x894a791236cbfdc5fd00d2d48f5be0b988d98804b89d9ce3f3c3c90477d590a1","urls":["bzzr://30f405a05448cc0f2efa99e3fc61ff424a8b6c1cee5c2ad05b5542fe41b58b39"]},"/Users/cryptotom/code/gitcoin/communiteths/contracts/bancor/utility/interfaces/IWhitelist.sol":{"keccak256":"0x6f2de503926432c5e49191520bdb0c0463ed69924287529b0f83ef95565287fb","urls":["bzzr://75da01831a1c6509463537ea59b0cfc88349b8ebb5d3fc56a1260d0e1953acdc"]}},"version":1}

nodes.documentation:
@dev Bancor Converter

The Bancor converter allows for conversions between a Smart Token and other ERC20 tokens and between different ERC20 tokens and themselves. 

The ERC20 connector balance can be virtual, meaning that the calculations are based on the virtual balance instead of relying on the actual connector balance.

This is a security mechanism that prevents the need to keep a very large (and valuable) balance in a single contract. 

The converter is upgradable (just like any SmartTokenController) and all upgrades are opt-in. 

WARNING: It is NOT RECOMMENDED to use the converter with Smart Tokens that have less than 8 decimal digits or with very small numbers because of precision loss 

Open issues:
- Front-running attacks are currently mitigated by the following mechanisms:
    - minimum return argument for each conversion provides a way to define a minimum/maximum price for the transaction
    - gas price limit prevents users from having control over the order of execution
    - gas price limit check can be skipped if the transaction comes from a trusted, whitelisted signer

Other potential solutions might include a commit/reveal based schemes
- Possibly add getters for the connector fields so that the client won't need to rely on the order in the struct
nodes.name: BancorConverter

@dev Bancor Converter

The Bancor converter allows for conversions between a Smart Token and other ERC20 tokens and between different ERC20 tokens and themselves. 

The ERC20 connector balance can be virtual, meaning that the calculations are based on the virtual balance instead of relying on the actual connector balance.

This is a security mechanism that prevents the need to keep a very large (and valuable) balance in a single contract. 

The converter is upgradable (just like any SmartTokenController) and all upgrades are opt-in. 

WARNING: It is NOT RECOMMENDED to use the converter with Smart Tokens that have less than 8 decimal digits or with very small numbers because of precision loss 

Open issues:
- Front-running attacks are currently mitigated by the following mechanisms:
    - minimum return argument for each conversion provides a way to define a minimum/maximum price for the transaction
    - gas price limit prevents users from having control over the order of execution
    - gas price limit check can be skipped if the transaction comes from a trusted, whitelisted signer

Other potential solutions might include a commit/reveal based schemes
- Possibly add getters for the connector fields so that the client won't need to rely on the order in the struct

acceptManagement().details: used by a new manager to accept a management transfer

acceptOwnership().details: used by a new owner to accept an ownership transfer

acceptTokenOwnership().details: used by a new owner to accept a token ownership transfer can only be called by the contract owner

addConnector(address,uint32,bool).details: defines a new connector for the token can only be called by the owner while the converter is inactive

params._enableVirtualBalance: true to enable virtual balance for the connector, false to disable it
params._weight: constant connector weight, represented in ppm, 1-1000000

claimTokens(address,uint256).details: allows the associated BancorX contract to claim tokens from any address (so that users dont have to first give allowance when calling BancorX)

params._amount: the amount of tokens to claim
params._from: address to claim the tokens from

completeXConversion2(address[],uint256,u.details: allows a user to convert BNT that was sent from another blockchain into any other token on the BancorNetwork without specifying the amount of BNT to be converted, but rather by providing the xTransferId which allows us to get the amount from BancorX.

params._conversionId: pre-determined unique (if non zero) id which refers to this transaction
params._minReturn: if the conversion results in an amount smaller than the minimum return - it is cancelled, must be nonzero
params._path: conversion path, see conversion path format in the BancorNetwork contract
params._signature: an array of the following elements:                        [0] uint256     custom value that was signed for prioritized conversion; must be equal to _conversionId                        [1] uint256     if the current block exceeded the given parameter - it is cancelled                        [2] uint8       (signature[128:130]) associated with the signer address and helps to validate if the signature is legit                        [3] bytes32     (signature[0:64]) associated with the signer address and helps to validate if the signature is legit                        [4] bytes32     (signature[64:128]) associated with the signer address and helps to validate if the signature is legit                        if the array is empty (length == 0), then the gas-price limit is verified instead of the signature

connectorTokenCount().details: returns the number of connector tokens defined

convert2(address,address,uint256,uint256.details: converts a specific amount of _fromToken to _toToken

params._minReturn: if the conversion results in an amount smaller than the minimum return - it is cancelled, must be nonzero

convertInternal(address,address,uint256,.details: converts a specific amount of _fromToken to _toToken can only be called by the bancor network contract

params._minReturn: if the conversion results in an amount smaller than the minimum return - it is cancelled, must be nonzero

disableConnectorSale(address,bool).details: disables converting from the given connector token in case the connector token got compromised can only be called by the owner note that converting to the token is still enabled regardless of this flag and it cannot be disabled by the owner

params._disable: true to disable the token, false to re-enable it

disableConversions(bool).details: disables the entire conversion functionality this is a safety mechanism in case of a emergency can only be called by the manager

params._disable: true to disable conversions, false to re-enable them

disableRegistryUpdate(bool).details: disables the registry update functionality this is a safety mechanism in case of a emergency can only be called by the manager or owner

params._disable: true to disable registry updates, false to re-enable them

disableTokenTransfers(bool).details: disables/enables token transfers can only be called by the contract owner

params._disable: true to disable transfers, false to enable them

fund(uint256).details: buys the token with all connector tokens using the same percentage i.e. if the caller increases the supply by 10%, it will cost an amount equal to 10% of each connector token balance can only be called if the max total weight is exactly 100% and while conversions are enabled

params._amount: amount to increase the supply by (in the smart token)

getConnectorBalance(address).details: returns the connector's virtual balance if one is defined, otherwise returns the actual balance

getCrossConnectorReturn(address,address,.details: returns the expected return for selling one of the connector tokens for another connector token

params._fromConnectorToken: contract address of the connector token to convert from
params._sellAmount: amount to sell (in the from connector token)
params._toConnectorToken: contract address of the connector token to convert to

getCrossConnectorReturn(address,address,.return: expected sale return amount and conversion fee (in the to connector token)

getFinalAmount(uint256,uint8).details: given a return amount, returns the amount minus the conversion fee

params._magnitude: 1 for standard conversion, 2 for cross connector conversion

getPurchaseReturn(address,uint256).details: returns the expected return for buying the token for a connector token

params._depositAmount: amount to deposit (in the connector token)

getPurchaseReturn(address,uint256).return: expected purchase return amount and conversion fee

getReturn(address,address,uint256).details: returns the expected return for converting a specific amount of _fromToken to _toToken
getReturn(address,address,uint256).return: expected conversion return amount and conversion fee

getSaleReturn(address,uint256).details: returns the expected return for selling the token for one of its connector tokens

params._sellAmount: amount to sell (in the smart token)

getSaleReturn(address,uint256).return: expected sale return amount and conversion fee

liquidate(uint256).details: sells the token for all connector tokens using the same percentage i.e. if the holder sells 10% of the supply, they will receive 10% of each connector token balance in return can only be called if the max total weight is exactly 100% note that the function can also be called if conversions are disabled

params._amount: amount to liquidate (in the smart token)

quickConvert2(address[],uint256,uint256,.details: converts the token to any other token in the bancor network by following a predefined conversion path note that when converting from an ERC20 token (as opposed to a smart token), allowance must be set beforehand

params._amount: amount to convert from (in the initial source token)
params._minReturn: if the conversion results in an amount smaller than the minimum return - it is cancelled, must be nonzero
params._path: conversion path, see conversion path format in the BancorNetwork contract

quickConvertPrioritized2(address[],uint2.details: converts the token to any other token in the bancor network by following a predefined conversion path note that when converting from an ERC20 token (as opposed to a smart token), allowance must be set beforehand

params._amount: amount to convert from (in the initial source token)
params._minReturn: if the conversion results in an amount smaller than the minimum return - it is cancelled, must be nonzero
params._path: conversion path, see conversion path format in the BancorNetwork contract
params._signature: an array of the following elements:                            [0] uint256     custom value that was signed for prioritized conversion; must be equal to _amount                            [1] uint256     if the current block exceeded the given parameter - it is cancelled                            [2] uint8       (signature[128:130]) associated with the signer address and helps to validate if the signature is legit                            [3] bytes32     (signature[0:64]) associated with the signer address and helps to validate if the signature is legit                            [4] bytes32     (signature[64:128]) associated with the signer address and helps to validate if the signature is legit                            if the array is empty (length == 0), then the gas-price limit is verified instead of the signature

restoreRegistry().details: security mechanism allowing the converter owner to revert to the previous registry, to be used in emergency scenario

setBancorX(address).details: allows the owner to set the associated BancorX contract

setConversionFee(uint32).details: updates the current conversion fee can only be called by the manager

params._conversionFee: new conversion fee, represented in ppm

setConversionWhitelist(address).details: allows the owner to update & enable the conversion whitelist contract address when set, only addresses that are whitelisted are actually allowed to use the converter note that the whitelist check is actually done by the BancorNetwork contract

transferManagement(address).details: allows transferring the contract management the new manager still needs to accept the transfer can only be called by the contract manager

transferOwnership(address).details: allows transferring the contract ownership the new owner still needs to accept the transfer can only be called by the contract owner

transferTokenOwnership(address).details: allows transferring the token ownership the new owner needs to accept the transfer can only be called by the contract owner note that token ownership can only be transferred while the owner is the converter upgrader contract

updateConnector(address,uint32,bool,uint.details: updates one of the token connectors can only be called by the owner

params._enableVirtualBalance: true to enable virtual balance for the connector, false to disable it
params._weight: constant connector weight, represented in ppm, 1-1000000

updateRegistry().details: sets the contract registry to whichever address the current registry is pointing to

upgrade().details: upgrades the converter to the latest version can only be called by the owner note that the owner needs to call acceptOwnership/acceptManagement on the new converter after the upgrade

withdrawFromToken(address,address,uint25.details: withdraws tokens held by the controller and sends them to an account can only be called by the owner

params._to: account to receive the new amount

withdrawTokens(address,address,uint256).details: withdraws tokens held by the converter and sends them to an account can only be called by the owner note that connector tokens can only be withdrawn by the owner while the converter is inactive unless the owner is the converter upgrader contract

params._to: account to receive the new amount
